item.title: The inexpensive cellphone you recently purchased may be counterfeit
item.description: The global black market for counterfeit and substandard cell phones is a significant issue, costing the industry an estimated US$6 billion each year, as reported in a recent study by the Mobile Manufacturers Forum (MMF). This comprehensive analysis, “Counterfeit/Substandard Mobile Phones - A Resource Guide for Governments”, examines the prevalence of these phones across all major brands. According to MMF Secretary General Michael Milligan, research suggests approximately 148 million counterfeit or substandard cell phones were sold in 2013 alone, primarily through established retail channels.
